page.title: 03Features of Baker Street
page.content: Baker Street is the only place in the area of Orsett boasting any industry other than farming. Along the street can be found a Hostel for Young Ladies, The Foxhound Riding Stables and a newly opened garden centre. The owner of the stables rents land in Fen Lane where a number of jumps and hurdles can be seen. The stables employs six full time staff. They are open from 8am to 8pm. Close by a garage can be found. It is built on a worked out sand and ballast pit. The garage has been there for forty years. The owners live in a house next to the garage which is twenty years old.The garage does car repairs and sells about 6000 gallons of petrol per week. Baker Street gets its name from J.Baker owner of Orsett Estate at the time of The Great Fire of London.
